body:
As a side note, I wondered why this has never come up before, but apparently someone noticed it when they wrote the following in a test.

https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/1772e3ee8e391d85158399e7caef7d86a8050c8e/jupiter-tests/src/test/java/org/junit/jupiter/params/ParameterizedTestIntegrationTests.java#L1258

Or perhaps they didn't really "notice" it and simply made the test pass. ðŸ˜†
I spiked a potential solution in this commit https://github.com/sbrannen/junit-framework/commit/4684a220c217f46fed1d8f1e774538eadbc4ea44.

issue.title: Consistently use `name = value` formatting for arguments with names in parameterized tests

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

As I mentioned in #4783, name-argument pairs in display names for parameterized classes and tests have different formatting/spacing depending on the use case.

When using `useHeadersInDisplayName` with `@CsvSource` or `@CsvFileSource`, they take the form `name = value`; whereas, when using the `{argumentsWithNames}` display name pattern, they take the form `name=value` (without spaces).

After discussing this within the team, we decided to consistently use the `name = value` formatting.

## Related Issues

- #4716
- #4783

issue.title: Quote text-based arguments in display names for parameterized tests

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

While discussing #4714 with @sormuras, he inquired about the `'null'` display name, which sparked an idea...

Namely, it would be quite nice to have an auto-quote feature for argument values in the display name for a `@ParameterizedClass` or `@ParameterizedTest`.

I therefore propose that we introduce a `boolean quoteText() default true` attribute (or similar) in `@ParameterizedClass` and `@ParameterizedTest` which signals to the `ParameterizedInvocationNameFormatter` that it should wrap `CharSequence` values (naturally including `String`) in double quotes (`""`) and wrap Character` values in single quotes (`''`).

Defaulting to `true` would make this an opt-out feature, but we could of course default to `false` to make it an opt-in feature.

Though, since we are introducing this in 6.0, perhaps it's better to make it an opt-out feature.

Note, however, that a `null` `CharSequence`/`Character` value would continue to be displayed as `null`, not `"null"` or `'null'`.

## Related Issues

- #4714 
- #4783 
- #4786

rename.from: CSV header names do not work with `{argumentsWithNames}` display name patterns
rename.to: CSV header names do not work with `{argumentsWithNames}` display name pattern

issue.title: Cache generated `{arguments}` patterns for parameterized tests

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

Currently, `{arguments}` patterns are generated for every `@ParameterizedTest` and `@ParameterizedClass`, which results in generation of the same pattern strings potentially hundreds of times per test suite.

Without any form of caching, JUnit Jupiter generates strings like `"{0}, {1}"`, `"{0}, {1}, {2}"`, `"{0}, {1}, {2}, {3}"`, etc. each time such a pattern is needed.

For example, when running `JupiterTestSuite` we currently generate `{arguments}` patterns 330 times. Whereas, with caching we only generate `{arguments}` patterns 10 times.

## Proposal

To prevent regeneration of identical patterns, we should cache each generated pattern in a map, keyed by the number of arguments.

Since #4783, we now generate identical patterns for the `{arguments}` and `{argumentsWithNames}` placeholders. Specifically, the `argumentsWithNamesPattern()` method was removed from `ParameterizedInvocationNameFormatter` in commit b9618a849014fd25b7489a9557c6261e7ba27765. In light of that it makes even more sense to cache the results.

## Related Issues

- #4783
